text:
I’m interviewing a client for my first video testimonial. For those who put these together are there any best practices you can share? Or any resources that were helpful?

For the interview part I have some questions from the StoryBrand Framework as a starting point. Is there anything I’m missing?

1. What was the problem you were having before you discovered our service?
2. What did the frustration feel like as you tried to solve that problem?
3. What was different about our service?
4. Take us to the moment when you realized our service was actually working to solve your problem.
5. Tell us what life looks like now that your problem is solved or being solved.

(Should I ask reformulate the questions using the 3rd person using my business name?)

text:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently working on a piece about “financials optimisation for digital marketing/SEO agencies” to be featured in our company’s library (inspired by the Cost structures / Revenue streams in the Business Model Canvas) and would love to interview 2-3 people working for financial management tools/SaaS companies for this target market. Do you have any recommendations? :eyes: Thanks a bunch!

elements.text:
Hello everyone,

Do you have any recommendations?
Thanks a bunch!

text:
I feel like this has been asked before on here but I'm not finding it through search…I apologize in advance if this feels repetitive but I’m going to go for it :woman-shrugging:.

I'm in charge of making a KPI dashboard for content. I'll need to use some sort of software that can pull metrics from multiple sources daily - social, GA, Marketo, Salesforce, etc. 

I have a few questions for anyone who has tackled a similar project…

1.) Is there a product that you are currently using to see your content metrics all in on place on a regular basis?
2.) What metrics should I include on this dashboard? 
3.) I’d love any resources that could possibly help me complete this project! Blogs, podcasts, courses, you name it. I’m always trying to learn.

elements.text: I feel like this has been asked before on here but I'm not finding it through search…I apologize in advance if this feels repetitive but I’m going to go for it

.

2.) What metrics should I include on this dashboard? 
3.) I’d love any resources that could possibly help me complete this project! Blogs, podcasts, courses, you name it. I’m always trying to learn.

text: From the tech side of things, you can create the dashboard with Google Data Studio and use Supermetrics to connect non-native integrations.

elements.text: From the tech side of things, you can create the dashboard with Google Data Studio and use Supermetrics to connect non-native integrations.

text: Yup, Google Data Studio was built for this! I really like Supermetrics as well but I’m not sure if they have a connector for Marketo yet.

elements.text: Yup, Google Data Studio was built for this! I really like Supermetrics as well but I’m not sure if they have a connector for Marketo yet.

text:
<@UUKNSLX9P> love marketmuse! Our writers use it daily :slightly_smiling_face:

Pros:

• connect feature helps suggest good internal linking
• super good for content audits / refreshing old content 
• use it a lot for brief creation / structure of an article
• we have seen direct boosts in article rankings from optimizing for higher "content scores" 
Cons:

• Annoyingly slow sometimes...
• Expensive 
• Unintuitive for writers / less tech friendly folks
• some of the keyword recommendations on a given topic can be very random

elements.text: love marketmuse! Our writers use it daily
Pros:
connect feature helps suggest good internal linking
super good for content audits / refreshing old content
use it a lot for brief creation / structure of an article
we have seen direct boosts in article rankings from optimizing for higher "content scores"
Cons:
Annoyingly slow sometimes...
Expensive
Unintuitive for writers / less tech friendly folks
some of the keyword recommendations on a given topic can be very random

text: Tableau is outstanding, but Google Data Studio is free. Native connections to GA, and can pull from Google Sheet files if you have static data or want to dump file exports into one master sheet. They have a LinkedIn Learning course that just went out recently too (I've not done it yet) - <https://www.linkedin.com/learning/learning-google-data-studio-for-marketers>

attachments.title: Learning Google Data Studio for Marketers | LinkedIn Learning, formerly Lynda.com
attachments.text: Learn how to create engaging and interactive dashboards to track your marketing campaigns with Google Data Studio.
attachments.fallback: LinkedIn: Learning Google Data Studio for Marketers | LinkedIn Learning, formerly Lynda.com

text: I like to divide the product features into different sections, and then build mini-funnels & topic clusters around those points. It will include content in all parts of the funnel, but will naturally extend your product up the funnel

text:
I"ve used both Clearscope & MarketMuse & agree with <@U01CH61LAVB>

Clearscope is great for grading/analyzing...MarketMuse is best for content ideation and topic clusters. Their tech is a little more advanced than Clearscope so it's sometimes harder to use

text:
I posted this in random, just thought I’d share it here too so nobody misses it. Venngage is putting together a Data Storytelling Benchmark Report. We want to understand and report on the many ways marketers in different industries are using data storytelling to do their jobs!

For those who have a few minutes to spare, could you share your thoughts and submit a response? <https://forms.gle/jh6zmwWDovPrkh6z8>

Thank you in advance! :pray:

text: I’ve never used seoclarity. These tools are good for optimization (clear scope) & capturing overall  user intent (MM)

elements.text: I’ve never used seoclarity. These tools are good for optimization (clear scope) & capturing overall  user intent (MM)

text: If you think of SEO as being broken into 3 pillars (off-site/links, technical/on-site, and content), MM/CS/CH all drive more directly at the heart of the "content" pillar. So you could use a platform like Conductor/seoClarity to find opportunities, scope growth potential, and how to interlink items on your site, etc... and these tools would ensure you created the best possible content to target those opportunities giving you the best chance to realize the growth potential identified (in some cases helping you draft the outline, or in other cases just mapping keywords that are most associated with your topic and speeding up some of the research writers or SEOs would do).

elements.text: If you think of SEO as being broken into 3 pillars (off-site/links, technical/on-site, and content), MM/CS/CH all drive more directly at the heart of the "content" pillar. So you could use a platform like Conductor/seoClarity to find opportunities, scope growth potential, and how to interlink items on your site, etc... and these tools would ensure you created the best possible content to target those opportunities giving you the best chance to realize the growth potential identified (in some cases helping you draft the outline, or in other cases just mapping keywords that are most associated with your topic and speeding up some of the research writers or SEOs would do).

text: IMO a marketmuse, contentharmony, or clearscope is a perfect complementary tool to a broader platform like conductor/seoclarity (though i've never used seoclarity myself - just going based off of BE/Conductor)

text:
Hi All, this sounds nuts, but, *any advice on describing impact without data?* A while back I did a B2B content campaign for a very, very large company and want to add a case study to my website BUT this was through an agency and they never give me info on how the content performs. I can't get the data using the various online tools (because the website has a zillion pages and only a few show up on those tools).  I can't contact the client because I'm still under a non-compete with the agency.
It was very good work and even won an award within the company. Bummer.

I can't get the data using the various online tools (because the website has a zillion pages and only a few show up on those tools).  I can't contact the client because I'm still under a non-compete with the agency.
It was very good work and even won an award within the company. Bummer.
